etymology.description: Depicts a kneeling man or figure with an ugly face (甶) + small 厶 (trace of tail) added later
etymology.interpretation: The character 鬼(鬼) (guǐ, "demon") visually represents a kneeling figure with a distinctive, mask-like face, evoking the image of a supernatural being or ghost. The addition of a small 厶 suggests a residual tail, enhancing its demon-like appearance. This depiction highlights the character's association with eerie, otherworldly entities.

examples.chinese: 深夜独行时(深夜獨行時)，忽遇鬼影飘忽(忽遇鬼影飄忽)。
examples.pinyin: Shēnyè dúxíng shí, hū yù guǐ yǐng piāohū.
examples.english: Walking alone in the deep night, suddenly encountering a fleeting ghostly silhouette.

examples.chinese: 村里流传故事说鬼出没(村裡流傳故事說鬼出沒)，人们夜半小心提灯(人們夜半小心提燈)。
examples.pinyin: Cūn lǐ liúchuán gùshì shuō guǐ chūmò, rénmen yèbàn xiǎoxīn tí dēng.
examples.english: Stories circulate in the village that demons haunt the area, so people cautiously carry lanterns at midnight.
